pageTextData.title: Coca Cola
pageTextData.subTitle: Original Taste
pageTextData.description: Confederate Colonel John Pemberton, wounded in the American Civil War and addicted to morphine, began a quest to find a substitute for the problematic drug. In 1885 at his drugstore in Columbus, Georgia, he registered Pemberton's French Wine Coca nerve tonic. Inspired by the success of Vin Mariani, a French-Corsican coca wine, Pemperton's recipe additionally included the African kola nut, the beverage's source of caffeine.

pageTextData.x3dCreationMethod: This model of a Rose's bottle was made in Blender 2.8 using a PBR material workflow, exported to Blender 2.7 via collada, exported as a .x3d, edited in Titiana and manually, and then displayed here using X_ite and X3D (no plugins used). It can be interacted with by right-clicking. Viewpoints will change the camera.
pageTextData.title: Rose's Lime Cordial
pageTextData.subTitle: The world's first concentrated fruit drink.
pageTextData.description: Lauchlan Rose, a ship chandler in Leith, began a process for preserving lime juice in 1865 and patented this method to preserve citrus juice without alcohol in 1867. He had realised that preserving the juice with sugar rather than alcohol opened the product up to a far wider market.

pageTextData.title: Appletiser
pageTextData.subTitle: Sparkling fruit juice
pageTextData.description: In 1966, Edmond Lombardi began creating his sparkling fruit juice, Appletiser, by blending fruit juice with carbonated water. The business was based in Elgin valley of the Western Cape, South Africa. Exports began in 1969 to two archipelagos: the Canary Islands (Spain) and Japan.

pageTextData.galleryDescription: These images were rendered from 3D models in Blender using Cycles. They are highly detailed, and use materials founded in Physically Based Rendering. Additional effects such as volumetrics and simulations have been added in the background.
